title: How to Connect a PC to a Mac

steps.title: Plug the cable to the Ethernet port on both of the machines.
steps.content: Plug the cable to the Ethernet port on both of the machines.

steps.title: Open a window on your PC.
steps.content: Open a window on your PC.

steps.title: Go to Homegroup.
steps.content: Go to Homegroup. On the directory panel at the left side of the window, click on “Homegroup.”

steps.title: Check all the type of files you want to share (documents, images, etc.
steps.content: Check all the type of files you want to share (documents, images, etc. ) and click on “Next.”

steps.title: Remember the password.
steps.content: Remember the password. On the following page, you’ll be given a password. Take note of the password. You’ll be using that later once you try to connect your Mac to your PC.

steps.title: Click on “Go” on the menu bar at the upper left of the desktop.
steps.content: Click on “Go” on the menu bar at the upper left of the desktop.

steps.title: Type in your PC’s network address on the Server Address field.
steps.content: Type in your PC’s network address on the Server Address field. Use the following format: smb://username@computername/sharename – i.e.: smb://johnny@mypc/users. If the above format won’t work, you can use the Windows PC’s IP address: smb://IPaddress/sharename.

steps.title: Click on the Plus (+) button to add it to the server list.
steps.content: Click on the Plus (+) button to add it to the server list.

steps.title: Click on the Server Address you’ve just added, and click on “Connect.
steps.content: Click on the Server Address you’ve just added, and click on “Connect. ”

steps.title: Type in the password that you got from the Windows PC.
steps.content: Type in the password that you got from the Windows PC. Click on “Connect.”

steps.title: Open your Mac’s Finder.
steps.content: Open your Mac’s Finder. The Windows PC’s name should now appear on the left panel under the Shared section.
